docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7. -- That approximately 25 per cent. of the deaths of persons whose occupations expose them to municipal or street dust and to general organic dust are due to tuberculosis is the fact disclosed in a bulletin prepared at the Bureau of Labor by Frederick L. Hoffman.

headline.main: MANY DEATHS FROM DUST.; Persons Exposed to It Show a High Percentage of Consumption.

docs.abstract: Labor Bur bulletin shows high rate of death among those whose occupations expose them to dust
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7. -- That approximately 25 per cent. of the deaths of persons whose occupations expose them to municipal or street dust and to general organic dust are due to tuberculosis is the fact disclosed in a bulletin prepared at the Bureau...
